service:
The Amazon Chime API (application programming interface) is designed for developers to perform key tasks, such as creating and managing Amazon Chime accounts, users, and Voice Connectors. This guide provides detailed information about the Amazon Chime API, including operations, types, inputs and outputs, and error codes. It also includes some server-side API actions to use with the Amazon Chime SDK. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.

You can use an AWS SDK, the AWS Command Line Interface (AWS CLI), or the REST API to make API calls. We recommend using an AWS SDK or the AWS CLI. Each API operation includes links to information about using it with a language-specific AWS SDK or the AWS CLI.

Using an AWS SDK

You don't need to write code to calculate a signature for request authentication. The SDK clients authenticate your requests by using access keys that you provide. For more information about AWS SDKs, see the AWS Developer Center.

Using the AWS CLI

Use your access keys with the AWS CLI to make API calls. For information about setting up the AWS CLI, see Installing the AWS Command Line Interface in the AWS Command Line Interface User Guide. For a list of available Amazon Chime commands, see the Amazon Chime commands in the AWS CLI Command Reference.

Using REST API

If you use REST to make API calls, you must authenticate your request by providing a signature. Amazon Chime supports signature version 4. For more information, see Signature Version 4 Signing Process in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.

When making REST API calls, use the service name chime and REST endpoint https://service.chime.aws.amazon.com.

Administrative permissions are controlled using AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM). For more information, see Identity and Access Management for Amazon Chime in the Amazon Chime Administration Guide.

operations.AssociatePhoneNumberWithUser: Associates a phone number with the specified Amazon Chime user.
operations.AssociatePhoneNumbersWithVoiceConnector: Associates phone numbers with the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
operations.AssociatePhoneNumbersWithVoiceConnectorG: Associates phone numbers with the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector group.
operations.BatchCreateAttendee: Creates up to 100 new attendees for an active Amazon Chime SDK meeting. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.
operations.BatchCreateRoomMembership: Adds up to 50 members to a chat room. Members can be either users or bots. The member role designates whether the member is a chat room administrator or a general chat room member.
operations.BatchDeletePhoneNumber:
Moves phone numbers into the Deletion queue. Phone numbers must be disassociated from any users or Amazon Chime Voice Connectors before they can be deleted.

Phone numbers remain in the Deletion queue for 7 days before they are deleted permanently.
operations.BatchSuspendUser:
Suspends up to 50 users from a Team or EnterpriseLWA Amazon Chime account. For more information about different account types, see Managing Your Amazon Chime Accounts in the Amazon Chime Administration Guide.

Users suspended from a Team account are dissasociated from the account, but they can continue to use Amazon Chime as free users. To remove the suspension from suspended Team account users, invite them to the Team account again. You can use the InviteUsers action to do so.

Users suspended from an EnterpriseLWA account are immediately signed out of Amazon Chime and can no longer sign in. To remove the suspension from suspended EnterpriseLWA account users, use the BatchUnsuspendUser action.

To sign out users without suspending them, use the LogoutUser action.
operations.BatchUnsuspendUser:
Removes the suspension from up to 50 previously suspended users for the specified Amazon Chime EnterpriseLWA account. Only users on EnterpriseLWA accounts can be unsuspended using this action. For more information about different account types, see Managing Your Amazon Chime Accounts in the Amazon Chime Administration Guide.

Previously suspended users who are unsuspended using this action are returned to Registered status. Users who are not previously suspended are ignored.
operations.BatchUpdatePhoneNumber:
Updates phone number product types or calling names. You can update one attribute at a time for each UpdatePhoneNumberRequestItem. For example, you can update either the product type or the calling name.

For product types, choose from Amazon Chime Business Calling and Amazon Chime Voice Connector. For toll-free numbers, you must use the Amazon Chime Voice Connector product type.

Updates to outbound calling names can take up to 72 hours to complete. Pending updates to outbound calling names must be complete before you can request another update.
operations.BatchUpdateUser: Updates user details within the UpdateUserRequestItem object for up to 20 users for the specified Amazon Chime account. Currently, only LicenseType updates are supported for this action.
operations.CreateAccount: Creates an Amazon Chime account under the administrator's AWS account. Only Team account types are currently supported for this action. For more information about different account types, see Managing Your Amazon Chime Accounts in the Amazon Chime Administration Guide.
operations.CreateAttendee: Creates a new attendee for an active Amazon Chime SDK meeting. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.
operations.CreateBot: Creates a bot for an Amazon Chime Enterprise account.
operations.CreateMeeting: Creates a new Amazon Chime SDK meeting in the specified media Region with no initial attendees. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.
operations.CreatePhoneNumberOrder: Creates an order for phone numbers to be provisioned. Choose from Amazon Chime Business Calling and Amazon Chime Voice Connector product types. For toll-free numbers, you must use the Amazon Chime Voice Connector product type.
operations.CreateRoom: Creates a chat room for the specified Amazon Chime account.
operations.CreateRoomMembership: Adds a member to a chat room. A member can be either a user or a bot. The member role designates whether the member is a chat room administrator or a general chat room member.
operations.CreateVoiceConnector:
Creates an Amazon Chime Voice Connector under the administrator's AWS account. You can choose to create an Amazon Chime Voice Connector in a specific AWS Region.

Enabling CreateVoiceConnectorRequest$RequireEncryption configures your Amazon Chime Voice Connector to use TLS transport for SIP signaling and Secure RTP (SRTP) for media. Inbound calls use TLS transport, and unencrypted outbound calls are blocked.
operations.CreateVoiceConnectorGroup:
Creates an Amazon Chime Voice Connector group under the administrator's AWS account. You can associate up to three existing Amazon Chime Voice Connectors with the Amazon Chime Voice Connector group by including VoiceConnectorItems in the request.

You can include Amazon Chime Voice Connectors from different AWS Regions in your group. This creates a fault tolerant mechanism for fallback in case of availability events.
operations.DeleteAccount:
Deletes the specified Amazon Chime account. You must suspend all users before deleting a Team account. You can use the BatchSuspendUser action to do so.

For EnterpriseLWA and EnterpriseAD accounts, you must release the claimed domains for your Amazon Chime account before deletion. As soon as you release the domain, all users under that account are suspended.

Deleted accounts appear in your Disabled accounts list for 90 days. To restore a deleted account from your Disabled accounts list, you must contact AWS Support.

After 90 days, deleted accounts are permanently removed from your Disabled accounts list.
operations.DeleteAttendee: Deletes an attendee from the specified Amazon Chime SDK meeting and deletes their JoinToken. Attendees are automatically deleted when a Amazon Chime SDK meeting is deleted. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.
operations.DeleteEventsConfiguration: Deletes the events configuration that allows a bot to receive outgoing events.
operations.DeleteMeeting: Deletes the specified Amazon Chime SDK meeting. When a meeting is deleted, its attendees are also deleted and clients can no longer join it. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.
operations.DeletePhoneNumber:
Moves the specified phone number into the Deletion queue. A phone number must be disassociated from any users or Amazon Chime Voice Connectors before it can be deleted.

Deleted phone numbers remain in the Deletion queue for 7 days before they are deleted permanently.
operations.DeleteRoomMembership: Removes a member from a chat room.
operations.DeleteVoiceConnector: Deletes the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector. Any phone numbers associated with the Amazon Chime Voice Connector must be disassociated from it before it can be deleted.
operations.DeleteVoiceConnectorGroup: Deletes the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector group. Any VoiceConnectorItems and phone numbers associated with the group must be removed before it can be deleted.
operations.DeleteVoiceConnectorOrigination: Deletes the origination settings for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
operations.DeleteVoiceConnectorStreamingConfigurati: Deletes the streaming configuration for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
operations.DeleteVoiceConnectorTermination: Deletes the termination settings for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
operations.DeleteVoiceConnectorTerminationCredentia: Deletes the specified SIP credentials used by your equipment to authenticate during call termination.
operations.DisassociatePhoneNumberFromUser: Disassociates the primary provisioned phone number from the specified Amazon Chime user.
operations.DisassociatePhoneNumbersFromVoiceConnect: Disassociates the specified phone numbers from the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
Disassociates the specified phone numbers from the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector group.
operations.GetAccount: Retrieves details for the specified Amazon Chime account, such as account type and supported licenses.
operations.GetAccountSettings: Retrieves account settings for the specified Amazon Chime account ID, such as remote control and dial out settings. For more information about these settings, see Use the Policies Page in the Amazon Chime Administration Guide.
operations.GetAttendee: Gets the Amazon Chime SDK attendee details for a specified meeting ID and attendee ID. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.
operations.GetBot: Retrieves details for the specified bot, such as bot email address, bot type, status, and display name.
operations.GetEventsConfiguration: Gets details for an events configuration that allows a bot to receive outgoing events, such as an HTTPS endpoint or Lambda function ARN.
operations.GetGlobalSettings: Retrieves global settings for the administrator's AWS account, such as Amazon Chime Business Calling and Amazon Chime Voice Connector settings.
operations.GetMeeting: Gets the Amazon Chime SDK meeting details for the specified meeting ID. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.
operations.GetPhoneNumber: Retrieves details for the specified phone number ID, such as associations, capabilities, and product type.
operations.GetPhoneNumberOrder: Retrieves details for the specified phone number order, such as order creation timestamp, phone numbers in E.164 format, product type, and order status.
operations.GetPhoneNumberSettings: Retrieves the phone number settings for the administrator's AWS account, such as the default outbound calling name.
operations.GetUser:
Retrieves details for the specified user ID, such as primary email address, license type, and personal meeting PIN.

To retrieve user details with an email address instead of a user ID, use the ListUsers action, and then filter by email address.
operations.GetUserSettings: Retrieves settings for the specified user ID, such as any associated phone number settings.
operations.GetVoiceConnector: Retrieves details for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector, such as timestamps, name, outbound host, and encryption requirements.
operations.GetVoiceConnectorGroup: Retrieves details for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector group, such as timestamps, name, and associated VoiceConnectorItems.
operations.GetVoiceConnectorLoggingConfiguration: Retrieves the logging configuration details for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector. Shows whether SIP message logs are enabled for sending to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
operations.GetVoiceConnectorOrigination: Retrieves origination setting details for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
operations.GetVoiceConnectorStreamingConfiguration: Retrieves the streaming configuration details for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector. Shows whether media streaming is enabled for sending to Amazon Kinesis. It also shows the retention period, in hours, for the Amazon Kinesis data.
operations.GetVoiceConnectorTermination: Retrieves termination setting details for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
operations.GetVoiceConnectorTerminationHealth: Retrieves information about the last time a SIP OPTIONS ping was received from your SIP infrastructure for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
operations.InviteUsers: Sends email to a maximum of 50 users, inviting them to the specified Amazon Chime Team account. Only Team account types are currently supported for this action.
operations.ListAccounts: Lists the Amazon Chime accounts under the administrator's AWS account. You can filter accounts by account name prefix. To find out which Amazon Chime account a user belongs to, you can filter by the user's email address, which returns one account result.
operations.ListAttendees: Lists the attendees for the specified Amazon Chime SDK meeting. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.
operations.ListBots: Lists the bots associated with the administrator's Amazon Chime Enterprise account ID.
operations.ListMeetings: Lists up to 100 active Amazon Chime SDK meetings. For more information about the Amazon Chime SDK, see Using the Amazon Chime SDK in the Amazon Chime Developer Guide.
operations.ListPhoneNumberOrders: Lists the phone number orders for the administrator's Amazon Chime account.
operations.ListPhoneNumbers: Lists the phone numbers for the specified Amazon Chime account, Amazon Chime user, Amazon Chime Voice Connector, or Amazon Chime Voice Connector group.
operations.ListRoomMemberships: Lists the membership details for the specified room, such as member IDs, member email addresses, and member names.
operations.ListRooms: Lists the room details for the specified Amazon Chime account. Optionally, filter the results by a member ID (user ID or bot ID) to see a list of rooms that the member belongs to.
operations.ListUsers: Lists the users that belong to the specified Amazon Chime account. You can specify an email address to list only the user that the email address belongs to.
operations.ListVoiceConnectorGroups: Lists the Amazon Chime Voice Connector groups for the administrator's AWS account.
operations.ListVoiceConnectorTerminationCredentials: Lists the SIP credentials for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
operations.ListVoiceConnectors: Lists the Amazon Chime Voice Connectors for the administrator's AWS account.
operations.LogoutUser: Logs out the specified user from all of the devices they are currently logged into.
operations.PutEventsConfiguration: Creates an events configuration that allows a bot to receive outgoing events sent by Amazon Chime. Choose either an HTTPS endpoint or a Lambda function ARN. For more information, see Bot.
operations.PutVoiceConnectorLoggingConfiguration: Adds a logging configuration for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector. The logging configuration specifies whether SIP message logs are enabled for sending to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
operations.PutVoiceConnectorOrigination: Adds origination settings for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
operations.PutVoiceConnectorStreamingConfiguration: Adds a streaming configuration for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector. The streaming configuration specifies whether media streaming is enabled for sending to Amazon Kinesis. It also sets the retention period, in hours, for the Amazon Kinesis data.
operations.PutVoiceConnectorTermination: Adds termination settings for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
operations.PutVoiceConnectorTerminationCredentials: Adds termination SIP credentials for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
operations.RegenerateSecurityToken: Regenerates the security token for a bot.
operations.ResetPersonalPIN: Resets the personal meeting PIN for the specified user on an Amazon Chime account. Returns the User object with the updated personal meeting PIN.
operations.RestorePhoneNumber: Moves a phone number from the Deletion queue back into the phone number Inventory.
operations.SearchAvailablePhoneNumbers: Searches phone numbers that can be ordered.
operations.UpdateAccount: Updates account details for the specified Amazon Chime account. Currently, only account name updates are supported for this action.
operations.UpdateAccountSettings: Updates the settings for the specified Amazon Chime account. You can update settings for remote control of shared screens, or for the dial-out option. For more information about these settings, see Use the Policies Page in the Amazon Chime Administration Guide.
operations.UpdateBot: Updates the status of the specified bot, such as starting or stopping the bot from running in your Amazon Chime Enterprise account.
operations.UpdateGlobalSettings: Updates global settings for the administrator's AWS account, such as Amazon Chime Business Calling and Amazon Chime Voice Connector settings.
operations.UpdatePhoneNumber:
Updates phone number details, such as product type or calling name, for the specified phone number ID. You can update one phone number detail at a time. For example, you can update either the product type or the calling name in one action.

For toll-free numbers, you must use the Amazon Chime Voice Connector product type.

Updates to outbound calling names can take up to 72 hours to complete. Pending updates to outbound calling names must be complete before you can request another update.
operations.UpdatePhoneNumberSettings: Updates the phone number settings for the administrator's AWS account, such as the default outbound calling name. You can update the default outbound calling name once every seven days. Outbound calling names can take up to 72 hours to update.
operations.UpdateRoom: Updates room details, such as the room name.
operations.UpdateRoomMembership: Updates room membership details, such as member role. The member role designates whether the member is a chat room administrator or a general chat room member. Member role can only be updated for user IDs.
operations.UpdateUser: Updates user details for a specified user ID. Currently, only LicenseType updates are supported for this action.
operations.UpdateUserSettings: Updates the settings for the specified user, such as phone number settings.
operations.UpdateVoiceConnector: Updates details for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
operations.UpdateVoiceConnectorGroup: Updates details for the specified Amazon Chime Voice Connector group, such as the name and Amazon Chime Voice Connector priority ranking.

AccessDeniedException.base: You don't have permissions to perform the requested operation.

Account.base: The Amazon Chime account details. An AWS account can have multiple Amazon Chime accounts.

refs.ListAccountsResponse$Accounts: List of Amazon Chime accounts and account details.

refs.CreateAccountRequest$Name: The name of the Amazon Chime account.
refs.ListAccountsRequest$Name: Amazon Chime account name prefix with which to filter results.
refs.UpdateAccountRequest$Name: The new name for the specified Amazon Chime account.

AccountSettings.base: Settings related to the Amazon Chime account. This includes settings that start or stop remote control of shared screens, or start or stop the dial-out option in the Amazon Chime web application. For more information about these settings, see Use the Policies Page in the Amazon Chime Administration Guide.

refs.UpdateAccountSettingsRequest$AccountSett: The Amazon Chime account settings to update.

refs.Account$AccountType: The Amazon Chime account type. For more information about different account types, see Managing Your Amazon Chime Accounts in the Amazon Chime Administration Guide.

Attendee.base:
An Amazon Chime SDK meeting attendee. Includes a unique AttendeeId and JoinToken. The JoinToken allows a client to authenticate and join as the specified attendee. The JoinToken expires when the meeting ends or when DeleteAttendee is called. After that, the attendee is unable to join the meeting.

We recommend securely transferring each JoinToken from your server application to the client so that no other client has access to the token except for the one authorized to represent the attendee.

refs.CreateAttendeeResponse$Attendee: The attendee information, including attendee ID and join token.

refs.BatchCreateAttendeeResponse$Attendees: The attendee information, including attendees IDs and join tokens.

BadRequestException.base: The input parameters don't match the service's restrictions.

refs.BatchCreateAttendeeResponse$Errors: If the action fails for one or more of the attendees in the request, a list of the attendees is returned, along with error codes and error messages.

refs.AccountSettings$DisableRemoteControl: Setting that stops or starts remote control of shared screens during meetings.
refs.AccountSettings$EnableDialOut: Setting that allows meeting participants to choose the Call me at a phone number option. For more information, see Join a Meeting without the Amazon Chime App.
refs.CreateVoiceConnectorRequest$RequireEncry: When enabled, requires encryption for the Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
refs.LoggingConfiguration$EnableSIPLogs: When true, enables SIP message logs for sending to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.
refs.Origination$Disabled: When origination settings are disabled, inbound calls are not enabled for your Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
refs.StreamingConfiguration$Disabled: When true, media streaming to Amazon Kinesis is turned off.
refs.Termination$Disabled: When termination settings are disabled, outbound calls can not be made.
refs.UpdateVoiceConnectorRequest$RequireEncry: When enabled, requires encryption for the Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
refs.VoiceConnector$RequireEncryption: Designates whether encryption is required for the Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

Bot.base: A resource that allows Enterprise account administrators to configure an interface to receive events from Amazon Chime.

BusinessCallingSettings.base: The Amazon Chime Business Calling settings for the administrator's AWS account. Includes any Amazon S3 buckets designated for storing call detail records.

refs.GetPhoneNumberSettingsResponse$CallingNa: The default outbound calling name for the account.
refs.PhoneNumber$CallingName: The outbound calling name associated with the phone number.
refs.UpdatePhoneNumberRequest$CallingName: The outbound calling name associated with the phone number.
refs.UpdatePhoneNumberSettingsRequest$Calling: The default outbound calling name for the account.

refs.Termination$CallingRegions: The countries to which calls are allowed, in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format. Required.

refs.CreateMeetingRequest$ClientRequestToken: The unique identifier for the client request. Use a different token for different meetings.

ConflictException.base: The request could not be processed because of conflict in the current state of the resource.

refs.Termination$CpsLimit: The limit on calls per second. Max value based on account service limit. Default value of 1.

CreateAttendeeError.base: The list of errors returned when errors are encountered during the BatchCreateAttendee and CreateAttendee actions. This includes external user IDs, error codes, and error messages.

CreateAttendeeRequestItem.base: The Amazon Chime SDK attendee fields to create, used with the BatchCreateAttendee action.

refs.BatchCreateAttendeeRequest$Attendees: The request containing the attendees to create.

Credential.base: The SIP credentials used to authenticate requests to your Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

refs.StreamingConfiguration$DataRetentionInHo: The retention period, in hours, for the Amazon Kinesis data.

refs.AssociatePhoneNumbersWithVoiceConnectorG: List of phone numbers, in E.164 format.
refs.AssociatePhoneNumbersWithVoiceConnectorR: List of phone numbers, in E.164 format.
refs.CreatePhoneNumberOrderRequest$E164PhoneN: List of phone numbers, in E.164 format.
refs.DisassociatePhoneNumbersFromVoiceConnect: List of phone numbers, in E.164 format.
List of phone numbers, in E.164 format.
refs.SearchAvailablePhoneNumbersResponse$E164: List of phone numbers, in E.164 format.

refs.Invite$EmailAddress: The email address to which the invite is sent.
refs.ListAccountsRequest$UserEmail: User email address with which to filter results.
refs.ListUsersRequest$UserEmail: Optional. The user email address used to filter results. Maximum 1.
refs.User$PrimaryEmail: The primary email address of the user.

EventsConfiguration.base: The configuration that allows a bot to receive outgoing events. Can be either an HTTPS endpoint or a Lambda function ARN.

refs.Attendee$ExternalUserId: The Amazon Chime SDK external user ID. Links the attendee to an identity managed by a builder application.
refs.CreateAttendeeError$ExternalUserId: The Amazon Chime SDK external user ID. Links the attendee to an identity managed by a builder application.
refs.CreateAttendeeRequest$ExternalUserId: The Amazon Chime SDK external user ID. Links the attendee to an identity managed by a builder application.
refs.CreateAttendeeRequestItem$ExternalUserId: The Amazon Chime SDK external user ID. Links the attendee to an identity managed by a builder application.

ForbiddenException.base: The client is permanently forbidden from making the request. For example, when a user tries to create an account from an unsupported Region.

refs.GetPhoneNumberOrderRequest$PhoneNumberOr: The ID for the phone number order.

Invite.base: Invitation object returned after emailing users to invite them to join the Amazon Chime Team account.

refs.Account$CreatedTimestamp: The Amazon Chime account creation timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.Bot$CreatedTimestamp: The bot creation timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.Bot$UpdatedTimestamp: The updated bot timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.GetPhoneNumberSettingsResponse$CallingNa: The updated outbound calling name timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.PhoneNumber$CreatedTimestamp: The phone number creation timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.PhoneNumber$UpdatedTimestamp: The updated phone number timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.PhoneNumber$DeletionTimestamp: The deleted phone number timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.PhoneNumberAssociation$AssociatedTimesta: The timestamp of the phone number association, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.PhoneNumberOrder$CreatedTimestamp: The phone number order creation timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.PhoneNumberOrder$UpdatedTimestamp: The updated phone number order timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.Room$CreatedTimestamp: The room creation timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.Room$UpdatedTimestamp: The room update timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.RoomMembership$UpdatedTimestamp: The room membership update timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.User$RegisteredOn: Date and time when the user is registered, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.User$InvitedOn: Date and time when the user is invited to the Amazon Chime account, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.VoiceConnector$CreatedTimestamp: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector creation timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.VoiceConnector$UpdatedTimestamp: The updated Amazon Chime Voice Connector timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.VoiceConnectorGroup$CreatedTimestamp: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector group creation timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.
refs.VoiceConnectorGroup$UpdatedTimestamp: The updated Amazon Chime Voice Connector group timestamp, in ISO 8601 format.

refs.Attendee$JoinToken: The join token used by the Amazon Chime SDK attendee.

refs.Account$DefaultLicense: The default license for the Amazon Chime account.
refs.UpdateUserRequest$LicenseType: The user license type to update. This must be a supported license type for the Amazon Chime account that the user belongs to.

refs.Account$SupportedLicenses: Supported licenses for the Amazon Chime account.

LoggingConfiguration.base: The logging configuration associated with an Amazon Chime Voice Connector. Specifies whether SIP message logs are enabled for sending to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

MediaPlacement.base: A set of endpoints used by clients to connect to the media service group for a Amazon Chime SDK meeting.

Meeting.base: A meeting created using the Amazon Chime SDK.

refs.CreateMeetingResponse$Meeting: The meeting information, including the meeting ID and MediaPlacement.

MeetingNotificationConfiguration.base: The configuration for resource targets to receive notifications when Amazon Chime SDK meeting and attendee events occur.

refs.CreateMeetingRequest$NotificationsConfig: The configuration for resource targets to receive notifications when meeting and attendee events occur.

Member.base: The member details, such as email address, name, member ID, and member type.

MemberError.base: The list of errors returned when a member action results in an error.

refs.BatchCreateRoomMembershipResponse$Errors: If the action fails for one or more of the member IDs in the request, a list of the member IDs is returned, along with error codes and error messages.

MembershipItem.base: Membership details, such as member ID and member role.

refs.AssociatePhoneNumbersWithVoiceConnectorG: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector group ID.
refs.CreateBotRequest$Domain: The domain of the Amazon Chime Enterprise account.
refs.CreateRoomMembershipRequest$MemberId: The Amazon Chime member ID (user ID or bot ID).
refs.DeleteRoomMembershipRequest$MemberId: The member ID (user ID or bot ID).
refs.DeleteVoiceConnectorGroupRequest$VoiceCo: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector group ID.
refs.DisassociatePhoneNumbersFromVoiceConnect: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector group ID.
refs.GetVoiceConnectorGroupRequest$VoiceConne: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector group ID.
refs.Member$MemberId: The member ID (user ID or bot ID).
refs.PhoneNumberError$PhoneNumberId: The phone number ID for which the action failed.
refs.RoomMembership$InvitedBy: The identifier of the user that invited the room member.
refs.UpdateVoiceConnectorGroupRequest$VoiceCo: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector group ID.
refs.UserError$UserId: The user ID for which the action failed.
refs.VoiceConnectorGroup$VoiceConnectorGroupI: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector group ID.

NotFoundException.base: One or more of the resources in the request does not exist in the system.

refs.AssociatePhoneNumbersWithVoiceConnectorG: If true, associates the provided phone numbers with the provided Amazon Chime Voice Connector Group and removes any previously existing associations. If false, does not associate any phone numbers that have previously existing associations.
refs.AssociatePhoneNumbersWithVoiceConnectorR: If true, associates the provided phone numbers with the provided Amazon Chime Voice Connector and removes any previously existing associations. If false, does not associate any phone numbers that have previously existing associations.
refs.Bot$Disabled: When true, the bot is stopped from running in your account.
refs.PhoneNumberCapabilities$InboundCall: Allows or denies inbound calling for the specified phone number.
refs.PhoneNumberCapabilities$OutboundCall: Allows or denies outbound calling for the specified phone number.
refs.PhoneNumberCapabilities$InboundSMS: Allows or denies inbound SMS messaging for the specified phone number.
refs.PhoneNumberCapabilities$OutboundSMS: Allows or denies outbound SMS messaging for the specified phone number.
refs.PhoneNumberCapabilities$InboundMMS: Allows or denies inbound MMS messaging for the specified phone number.
refs.PhoneNumberCapabilities$OutboundMMS: Allows or denies outbound MMS messaging for the specified phone number.
refs.UpdateBotRequest$Disabled: When true, stops the specified bot from running in your account.

OrderedPhoneNumber.base: A phone number for which an order has been placed.

refs.PhoneNumberOrder$OrderedPhoneNumbers: The ordered phone number details, such as the phone number in E.164 format and the phone number status.

Origination.base: Origination settings enable your SIP hosts to receive inbound calls using your Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

OriginationRoute.base: Origination routes define call distribution properties for your SIP hosts to receive inbound calls using your Amazon Chime Voice Connector. Limit: Ten origination routes for each Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

refs.Origination$Routes: The call distribution properties defined for your SIP hosts. Valid range: Minimum value of 1. Maximum value of 20.

refs.OriginationRoute$Priority: The priority associated with the host, with 1 being the highest priority. Higher priority hosts are attempted first.

refs.OriginationRoute$Protocol: The protocol to use for the origination route. Encryption-enabled Amazon Chime Voice Connectors use TCP protocol by default.

refs.OriginationRoute$Weight: The weight associated with the host. If hosts are equal in priority, calls are distributed among them based on their relative weight.

PhoneNumber.base: A phone number used for Amazon Chime Business Calling or an Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

PhoneNumberAssociation.base: The phone number associations, such as Amazon Chime account ID, Amazon Chime user ID, Amazon Chime Voice Connector ID, or Amazon Chime Voice Connector group ID.

refs.ListPhoneNumbersRequest$FilterName: The filter to use to limit the number of results.
refs.PhoneNumberAssociation$Name: Defines the association with an Amazon Chime account ID, user ID, Amazon Chime Voice Connector ID, or Amazon Chime Voice Connector group ID.

PhoneNumberCapabilities.base: The phone number capabilities for Amazon Chime Business Calling phone numbers, such as enabled inbound and outbound calling and text messaging.

PhoneNumberError.base: If the phone number action fails for one or more of the phone numbers in the request, a list of the phone numbers is returned, along with error codes and error messages.

refs.AssociatePhoneNumbersWithVoiceConnectorG: If the action fails for one or more of the phone numbers in the request, a list of the phone numbers is returned, along with error codes and error messages.
refs.AssociatePhoneNumbersWithVoiceConnectorR: If the action fails for one or more of the phone numbers in the request, a list of the phone numbers is returned, along with error codes and error messages.
refs.BatchDeletePhoneNumberResponse$PhoneNumb: If the action fails for one or more of the phone numbers in the request, a list of the phone numbers is returned, along with error codes and error messages.

PhoneNumberOrder.base: The details of a phone number order created for Amazon Chime.

refs.PhoneNumberOrder$Status: The status of the phone number order.

refs.OriginationRoute$Port: The designated origination route port. Defaults to 5060.

refs.ListUsersRequest$MaxResults: The maximum number of results to return in a single call. Defaults to 100.

refs.Bot$SecurityToken: The security token used to authenticate Amazon Chime with the outgoing event endpoint.
refs.Credential$Username: The RFC2617 compliant user name associated with the SIP credentials, in US-ASCII format.
refs.Credential$Password: The RFC2617 compliant password associated with the SIP credentials, in US-ASCII format.
refs.EventsConfiguration$OutboundEventsHTTPSE: HTTPS endpoint that allows a bot to receive outgoing events.
refs.EventsConfiguration$LambdaFunctionArn: Lambda function ARN that allows a bot to receive outgoing events.
refs.PutEventsConfigurationRequest$OutboundEv: HTTPS endpoint that allows the bot to receive outgoing events.
refs.PutEventsConfigurationRequest$LambdaFunc: Lambda function ARN that allows the bot to receive outgoing events.
refs.User$PrimaryProvisionedNumber: The primary phone number associated with the user.

refs.DeleteVoiceConnectorTerminationCredentia: The RFC2617 compliant username associated with the SIP credentials, in US-ASCII format.

StreamingConfiguration.base: The streaming configuration associated with an Amazon Chime Voice Connector. Specifies whether media streaming is enabled for sending to Amazon Kinesis, and shows the retention period for the Amazon Kinesis data, in hours.

refs.Bot$UserId: The unique ID for the bot user.
refs.BusinessCallingSettings$CdrBucket: The Amazon S3 bucket designated for call detail record storage.
refs.CreateMeetingRequest$MediaRegion: The Region in which to create the meeting. Available values: us-east-1, us-west-2.

refs.ListPhoneNumberOrdersResponse$NextToken: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results.

refs.Meeting$MediaRegion: The Region in which to create the meeting. Available values: us-east-1, us-west-2.
refs.OriginationRoute$Host: The FQDN or IP address to contact for origination traffic.
refs.PhoneNumberAssociation$Value: Contains the ID for the entity specified in Name.
refs.SearchAvailablePhoneNumbersRequest$AreaC: The area code used to filter results.
refs.SearchAvailablePhoneNumbersRequest$NextT: The token to use to retrieve the next page of results.
refs.VoiceConnector$OutboundHostName: The outbound host name for the Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
refs.VoiceConnectorSettings$CdrBucket: The Amazon S3 bucket designated for call detail record storage.

refs.Termination$CidrAllowedList: The IP addresses allowed to make calls, in CIDR format. Required.

TelephonySettings.base: Settings that allow management of telephony permissions for an Amazon Chime user, such as inbound and outbound calling and text messaging.

refs.UserSettings$Telephony: The telephony settings associated with the user.

Termination.base: Termination settings enable your SIP hosts to make outbound calls using your Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

TerminationHealth.base: The termination health details, including the source IP address and timestamp of the last successful SIP OPTIONS message from your SIP infrastructure.

ThrottledClientException.base: The client exceeded its request rate limit.

refs.SearchAvailablePhoneNumbersRequest$TollF: The toll-free prefix that you use to filter results.

UnauthorizedClientException.base: The client is not currently authorized to make the request.

UnprocessableEntityException.base: The request was well-formed but was unable to be followed due to semantic errors.

UpdatePhoneNumberRequestItem.base: The phone number ID, product type, or calling name fields to update, used with the BatchUpdatePhoneNumber and UpdatePhoneNumber actions.

refs.BatchUpdatePhoneNumberRequest$UpdatePhon: The request containing the phone number IDs and product types or calling names to update.

UpdateUserRequestItem.base: The user ID and user fields to update, used with the BatchUpdateUser action.

refs.BatchUpdateUserRequest$UpdateUserRequest: The request containing the user IDs and details to update.

User.base: The user on the Amazon Chime account.

refs.ResetPersonalPINResponse$User: The user details and new personal meeting PIN.

refs.InviteUsersRequest$UserEmailList: The user email addresses to which to send the email invitation.

UserError.base: The list of errors returned when errors are encountered during the BatchSuspendUser, BatchUnsuspendUser, or BatchUpdateUser actions. This includes user IDs, error codes, and error messages.

refs.BatchSuspendUserResponse$UserErrors: If the BatchSuspendUser action fails for one or more of the user IDs in the request, a list of the user IDs is returned, along with error codes and error messages.
refs.BatchUnsuspendUserResponse$UserErrors: If the BatchUnsuspendUser action fails for one or more of the user IDs in the request, a list of the user IDs is returned, along with error codes and error messages.
refs.BatchUpdateUserResponse$UserErrors: If the BatchUpdateUser action fails for one or more of the user IDs in the request, a list of the user IDs is returned, along with error codes and error messages.

refs.BatchSuspendUserRequest$UserIdList: The request containing the user IDs to suspend.
refs.BatchUnsuspendUserRequest$UserIdList: The request containing the user IDs to unsuspend.

UserSettings.base: Settings associated with an Amazon Chime user, including inbound and outbound calling and text messaging.

VoiceConnector.base: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector configuration, including outbound host name and encryption settings.

refs.UpdateVoiceConnectorResponse$VoiceConnec: The updated Amazon Chime Voice Connector details.

refs.CreateVoiceConnectorRequest$AwsRegion: The AWS Region in which the Amazon Chime Voice Connector is created. Default value: us-east-1.
refs.VoiceConnector$AwsRegion: The AWS Region in which the Amazon Chime Voice Connector is created. Default: us-east-1.

VoiceConnectorGroup.base: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector group configuration, including associated Amazon Chime Voice Connectors. You can include Amazon Chime Voice Connectors from different AWS Regions in your group. This creates a fault tolerant mechanism for fallback in case of availability events.

refs.CreateVoiceConnectorGroupResponse$VoiceC: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector group details.
refs.GetVoiceConnectorGroupResponse$VoiceConn: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector group details.
refs.UpdateVoiceConnectorGroupResponse$VoiceC: The updated Amazon Chime Voice Connector group details.

refs.ListVoiceConnectorGroupsResponse$VoiceCo: The details of the Amazon Chime Voice Connector groups.

refs.CreateVoiceConnectorGroupRequest$Name: The name of the Amazon Chime Voice Connector group.
refs.UpdateVoiceConnectorGroupRequest$Name: The name of the Amazon Chime Voice Connector group.
refs.VoiceConnectorGroup$Name: The name of the Amazon Chime Voice Connector group.

VoiceConnectorItem.base: For Amazon Chime Voice Connector groups, the Amazon Chime Voice Connectors to which to route inbound calls. Includes priority configuration settings. Limit: 3 VoiceConnectorItems per Amazon Chime Voice Connector group.

refs.CreateVoiceConnectorGroupRequest$VoiceCo: The Amazon Chime Voice Connectors to route inbound calls to.
refs.VoiceConnectorGroup$VoiceConnectorItems: The Amazon Chime Voice Connectors to which to route inbound calls.

refs.VoiceConnectorItem$Priority: The priority associated with the Amazon Chime Voice Connector, with 1 being the highest priority. Higher priority Amazon Chime Voice Connectors are attempted first.

refs.ListVoiceConnectorsResponse$VoiceConnect: The details of the Amazon Chime Voice Connectors.

refs.CreateVoiceConnectorRequest$Name: The name of the Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
refs.UpdateVoiceConnectorRequest$Name: The name of the Amazon Chime Voice Connector.
refs.VoiceConnector$Name: The name of the Amazon Chime Voice Connector.

VoiceConnectorSettings.base: The Amazon Chime Voice Connector settings. Includes any Amazon S3 buckets designated for storing call detail records.
